meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flimsy.
meanings.sent1: The flimsinesses of the paper made it tear easily.
meanings.sent2: The builder was concerned about the flimsinesses of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The flimsinesses of the excuse were so obvious that no one believed it.
meanings.sent4: The flimsinesses of the argument crumbled under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of avoiding flimsinesses in research papers.

meanings.sent1: She was disappointed by the flimsinesses of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The flimsinesses of his promises made her doubt his sincerity.
meanings.sent3: The flimsinesses of the alibi were exposed by the security footage.
meanings.sent4: The flimsinesses of the bridge became apparent during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The detective quickly saw through the flimsinesses of the suspect's story.

meanings.sent1: The doctor warned about the flimsinesses of the patient's immune system.
meanings.sent2: The flimsinesses of the glass made it shatter upon impact.
meanings.sent3: The flimsinesses of the old vase made it a risky choice for the clumsy cat owner.
meanings.sent4: The flimsinesses of the thread caused the button to fall off.
meanings.sent5: The flimsinesses of the relationship became evident during tough times.
